§8§oAndrew Steane§r

§71996§r

Comments: \u00a77\u00a7oSubmitted to Proc. Roy. Soc. Lond. A. in November 1995, accepted May 1996. 39 pages, 6 figures. This isnow the final version. The changes are some added references, changed final figure, and a more precise use of the

word `decoherence'. I would like to propose the word `defection' fora general unknown error of a single qubit (rotation and/or entanglement). It is useful because it captures the nature ofthe error process, andhas a verb form `to

defect'. Random unitarychanges (rotations) of a qubit are caused by defects in the quantum computer; to entangle randomly with the environment is to form atreacherous alliance with an enemy of successful quantum\u00a7r
